free_text.Learning outcomes: To give the basics for the understanding and the description of ultrafast phenomena in many-body systems, in particular condensed matter and biological systems.
free_text.Content: This course is an introduction to the basic principles underlying the ultrafast response of matter excitation by light. These basic principles consist in the time-dependent formalisms of quantum mechanics in Hilbert and Liouville space. This response is characterized in atomic and molecular systems, in condensed matter (solids and liquids) and in biological molecules.[br/]Finally, a review of experimental laser techniques based on ultrafast laser pulses (pump-probe, 4-wave mixing photon echo, etc..) is presented.
